glsa.title: ImageMagick: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: An integer overflow in ImageMagick might allow remote attackers to cause the remote execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: ImageMagick is a collection of tools and libraries for manipulating various image formats.

description.p: Tielei Wang has discovered that the XMakeImage() function in magick/xwindow.c is prone to an integer overflow, possibly leading to a buffer overflow.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted image, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application, or a Denial of Service.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All ImageMagick users should upgrade to an unaffected version:
NOTE: This is a legacy GLSA. Updates for all affected architectures are available since June 4, 2009. It is likely that your system is already no longer affected by this issue.
